content:
TITLE: Using Kubit UI React Components
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to import and use the `Button` and `KubitProvider` components from the `@kubit-ui-web/react-components` package in a React application.  The `KubitProvider` is essential for providing the theme and other necessary context.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubit-ui/kubit-react-components/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: tsx
CODE:
```
import { Button, KubitProvider } from '@kubit-ui-web/react-components';
import React from 'react';

const App = () => {
  return (
    <KubitProvider>
      <Button variant="PRIMARY" size="MEDIUM">
        Click me
      </Button>
    </KubitProvider>
  );
};

export default App;
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Icon Component
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to import and use the Icon component in a React application. It shows how to pass the icon name, alternative text, width, and height as props to the Icon component. The Icon component will render the appropriate icon based on the 'icon' prop.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubit-ui/kubit-react-components/blob/main/src/components/icon/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import Icon from 'Icon';

const icon = 'ARROW_ICON';

<Icon icon={icon} altText="Arrow" width="24px" height="24px" />;
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Container Component
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates basic usage of the Container component in a React application.  It wraps a div element with a red background and a height of 100px.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubit-ui/kubit-react-components/blob/main/src/components/container/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
<Container>
  <div style={{ background: 'red', height: '100px' }} />
</Container>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Kubit UI React Components with npm
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the Kubit UI React Components library and its dependencies using npm. It adds the package to the project's `node_modules` directory and updates the `package.json` file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubit-ui/kubit-react-components/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install @kubit-ui-web/react-components
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Kubit UI React Components with yarn
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the Kubit UI React Components library and its dependencies using yarn. It adds the package to the project's `node_modules` directory and updates the `yarn.lock` file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubit-ui/kubit-react-components/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn add @kubit-ui-web/react-components
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing Container Component
DESCRIPTION: Imports the Container component from the '@kubit' package. This is a necessary step to use the component in a React application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubit-ui/kubit-react-components/blob/main/src/components/container/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import Container from '@kubit';
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Storybook with npm
DESCRIPTION: This command starts the Storybook server using npm, allowing developers to interactively view and test the Kubit UI React Components.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubit-ui/kubit-react-components/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run storybook
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Storybook with yarn
DESCRIPTION: This command starts the Storybook server using yarn, providing an interactive environment for viewing and testing the Kubit UI React Components.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubit-ui/kubit-react-components/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn storybook
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running tests with yarn
DESCRIPTION: This command executes the project's tests using yarn and shows the results in the terminal.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubit-ui/kubit-react-components/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn test
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running tests with npm
DESCRIPTION: This command executes the project's tests using npm and displays the results in the terminal.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubit-ui/kubit-react-components/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run test
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning a git repository
DESCRIPTION: This command clones a git repository to your local machine.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubit-ui/kubit-react-components/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
git clone
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a git branch
DESCRIPTION: This command creates a new branch in your local git repository.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubit-ui/kubit-react-components/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
git checkout -b <branch-name>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Committing changes to git
DESCRIPTION: This command commits the changes to the branch of git
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubit-ui/kubit-react-components/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
git commit -m "Your commit message"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Pushing changes to remote git repository
DESCRIPTION: This command pushes changes to the remote git repository.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubit-ui/kubit-react-components/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
git push origin <branch-name>
```
